artist: Artist: Wenceslaus Hollar; Artist: After a follower of Hans Holbein the Younger
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: mob of men carrying staffs, ropes, and swords addressing Jesus's body on the ground at lower center; man with sword stands over Jesus
inscription:
Inscription

inscribed in plate: [Peter cuts of the high Preistes, Servants eare / Peter who should the Keies, no weapon beare, / But warre and weapons with his fellowes since / A bove the Keies have got Praheminence.]

numbered in plate at lower right: [3]
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Christ Taken, From the Satirical Passion
